{"step_by_step_thinking": "Reed-Sternberg cells are the characteristic cells of Hodgkin's lymphoma. According to the documents, these cells are usually derived from B lymphocytes. Document [2] also states that Reed-Sternberg cells with B-cell phenotypes have rearranged VH genes, indicating that these cells arise from B cells.
